narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We also had pre-lab zoom lectures that were helpful for contextualizing what we would do in-person.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The lab techniques helped to understand the lecture content.

Overall this course was useful into witnessing and performing the same experiments that other neuroscientists used when discovering the fundamentals of neuroscience. For example,  we used tools that allowed us to witness the physical properties and appearance of an action potential. We also used the frog neuromuscular junction in order to analyze and observe synaptic transmission and more!
I learned about various neurophysiological instruments and recording techniques in a variety of model systems.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
strengths: interesting lab concepts, gave us some in-person interaction (safely) amongst all the virtual classes, 
weaknesses: labs take so long and we often could not get any results ourselves so at times it felt like we were just sitting there confused as to how to get our stuff to work

The experiments were interesting, but often took a lot of troubleshooting to get to work (which I guess is more of a reflection on the field than the course itself), so it could be frustrating. My biggest frustration with the course was Tatiana, one of the TAsI know she had our best interests in mind, but I was scared to ask her for help at times as whenever I did I ended up even more confused than I was at first as well as feeling very intellectually inferior.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: There were very few people in the lab so I felt pretty safe and like everything was effectively taught as possible.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yea it wasn't too bad - it ended up being fun because it was such a small number of us
Yes, it was a good course.
I would recommend it to other Neuroscience majors who are interested in learning recording techniques
